### **Government Tender Announcement: Airfield Lighting Control & Monitoring System (ALCMS) and Constant Current Regulatory (CCR) Replacement**

#### **Title:** (ACAN) CL220012 – Airfield Lighting Control & Monitoring System (ALCMS) and Constant Current Regulatory (CCR) Replacement 4 Wing Cold Lake, Alberta

#### **Reference:** PW-22-01008786

#### **Public Posting Date:** 2022-09-29

#### **Tender Closing Date & Time:** 2022-10-13T16:00:00
###### **Tender Details:**

This Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) invites one qualified supplier to express interest in providing Airfield Lighting Control and Monitoring System (ALCMS) and Constant Current Regulatory (CCR) replacement services for 4 Wing Cold Lake, Alberta.

The project involves:

1.  Retrofitting 33 Hughey & Phillip CCRs from analog control and display to digital control and display, including automatic insulation resistance monitoring data system and system monitoring/trending and logging features.
2.  Supplying and installing a PLC-based ALCMS with three (3) operator stations, providing remote access and support, including software upgrades, using multiple communications protocols.
3.  Commissioning, calibration, user training, and documentation.
4.  A minimum 5-year warranty and post-installation user support.

**Key Performance Requirements:**

The successful supplier must have the capability to meet the following requirements:

*   Design and replace analog Constant Current Regulatory doors with digitally controlled Constant Current Regulator doors, compatible with Hughey & Phillip CCRs.
*   Provide a software package to update ALCMS, enabling communication with retrofitted digital CCR doors.
*   Complete the project within 120 days after contract award, within a maximum budget of $750,000.00.

**Security Clearance:**

The chosen supplier must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS), issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD).

**Submission Requirements:**

 Suppliers interested in this opportunity must submit a statement of capabilities, demonstrating their ability to meet the requirements, on or before the tender closing date and time.

See attached document for detailed requirements. Please contact Sumbul Siddiqui, Coordinator, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada (DCC), at Sumbul.siddiqui@dcc-cdc.gc.ca for any inquiries. 



Revisions and Exclusions made:

*   Title reformatted for better clarity and organization
